column4: 2018 09:31------The two delegations expressed their deep appreciation for the visit and discussions with Mr. Pen Sour Sang
column5: Minister of Commerce at the Ministry of Commerce office on Thursday
column8: both Mr. Kridelka and Mr. Coates appreciated Cambodia’s  progressive features
column9: particularly physical infrastructure and attractive investment climate. The two envoys also invited the minister to attend the Cambodia-Belgian Business Forum
column10: which is scheduled for early December
column11: to promote cooperation between the two countries’ private sectors.------In response
column12: Mr. Pen Sambath agreed to attend and thanked Mr.  Kridelka and Mr. Coates
column13: who supported and gave credibility to Cambodia.------The Minister informed both missionaries about Cambodia’s strong economic growth
column14: investment policies and incentive policies for foreign investors.------The minister also highlighted the benefits of the Special Economic Zones and the Techno Park Industrial Park
column15: which  manufactures automotive components for export to regional and global markets under the preferential system provided by 32 countries
column17: the Minister also shared the vision of the Royal Government of Cambodia to transform Cambodia into a high-income country by 2030 and a high-income middle-income country by 2050.------The Kingdom of Cambodia and the Kingdom of Belgium  renewed diplomatic ties on 12 November 1992. Today
column18: the two countries have become economic and trade partners and have been supporting each other on the international arena. In 2017
column19: the bilateral trade volume between Cambodia and Belgium reached 411 million US dollars
column20: and for the first seven months of 2018
